In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Sure! Here is the function that you can use in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```
This function first lowercases the column name, strips leading and trailing whitespaces and then replaces spaces or hyphens with underscores. It uses a regular expression `r"[\s-]"` to match any whitespace or hyphen character.

You can call this function like so:
```julia
col = " My Column  "
println(clean_column(col)) # Outputs: my_column
```
